title: Can Yasuo's Windwall Start Infront of him Instead of Coming Out of Him?
body: It's annoying when you're trying to hit Yasuo with in an ability and he blocks it. You know what's even more annoying? When the projectile is about to hit him and his reaction time is the same as a potato, but he manages to fart up a cloud of wind just in time to destroy your projectile when it's right on top of him. Yasuo should be rewarded for good reaction times, not for randomly hitting W.

replies.body: That's not the worst. what is worse is that he put his wall facing the WRONG way but since it's on top of him, it blocks it.

I've rarely had this happen (if ever) and I play A LOT of Yasuo. maybe i've just never used it when I was facing the wrong way though, so it really could be there. I'm just saying, I've never experienced it and I've played him a lot. I'll have to give this a test myself. You have 5 upvotes so its either A) some type of client side visual bug for you guys or B) its actually happening like that, in which case I'm assuming the collide point for the projectile is bugged, and not the wall itself.
I get that you haven't seen it (didn't downvote you, ppl b rude), but it DOES indeed work that way. Pretty well documented.

Windwall is one of those abilities that I feel like has prevented Riot from giving us a replay system. I've seen so many abilities that were clearly past it when it was cast just flat out warp back and disappear. If we could slow it down and replay it without 3rd party plugins the forums would be littered with reports on how bad this ability is.
But the forums are still littered with reports about how bad this ability is anyways x'D

It should spawn a couple of pixels in the direction that Yasuo uses the skill, instead of right on top of him -- perhaps at the edge of his model.  That way he can't block projectiles in the opposite direction or either side, only in the direction he cast the wall, but can still block point-blank projectiles with a small enough reaction time (unless a TF or Anivia gets a Phantom Dancer to ignore unit collision).

Also, change the hitbox to actually match the graphics (or make the graphics sharper to highlight its hitbox). Right now I believe it's slightly larger.

That's a simply and straightforward nerf. It does also feel weird as other spellshields/Braum's shield all activate instantly right on the champion model and not in front of it. The reaction window is of Yasuo is comparable with any other ability that is kinda alike. You are asking for an unreasonable nerf on a champion who is shit atm.
Stop the circlejerk.

Wind Wall activates at the instant of casting and gives him a frame of projectile blocking, because his hitbox is smaller than Wind Wall. He can literally block a shot by throwing Wind Wall in the opposite direction if he does it at the right moment.

Yes, it's a nerf. To a really stupid interaction.

> b: would need incredible timing (probably needs more timing than every other skill in LoL)

I've done it. And I'm no prodigy. Hell, I'm walking around with a Silver badge, albeit because I barely play Ranked, and I've done it. I've also seen it done in game, multiple times in the same match, by my friends.

It takes the same kind of timing as using Spell Shield at the instant of impact.
> c: is still not better than a regular spellshield 

Sure, I can give you that. It's the reason I'm on the side of keeping Wind Wall, because it's an interesting mechanic with power in line with its weaknesses.
> As I said, it's nothing special but rather common. There is no stupid interaction.

It's not supposed to be a radial spell shield. It's supposed to be a directional blocking ability. Being able to use it *wrong* and still have it work properly is a stupid interaction.

The only problem with this is that he would no longer be able to block projectiles at point blank range. This is extremely significant against champs like {{champion:103}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:4}}{{champion:99}}  since they rely on projectile based hard CC for self peel. Being able to block those CC's at a very close range is the only way Yasuo has a chance against these kinds of champions since his only way to deter aggression from them is by attempting an all in. And at that range, with the exception of TF, you pretty much have to windwall predictively because you simply don't have time to react at ranges shorter than 200 units, especially if they're already facing you when they cast the spell.

He doesn't really counter anyone at this point. There's a reason he only has a 50%+ winrate against 4 mid laners and below 50% against 39 of them. Hell, he has below 40% against 4 of them. And that's with an average of 106 games played.
